notes: Two city councilors and their driver were wounded during an ambush by unidentified armed men in Barangay Malhacan, Meycauayan on February 1.
Two military informants were killed by Abu Sayyaf rebels in Barangay Latih, Patikul, Sulu on February 1. They provided intelligence against the Abu Sayyaf. 4 bystanders were wounded.

Defusal: Police officers recovered and disarmed an improvised explosive device allegedly planted by Abu Sayyaf rebels in front of the house of a government engineer in Isabela City, Basilan on February 1.

The police and soldiers from the 55th Infantry Battalion were ambushed by suspected Abu Sayyaf rebels at border of the Barangays Bolinsong and Ingud in Pualas, Lanao del Sur on February 1. There were no casualties.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star; Bombo Radyo; Bicol Standard
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Calabanga, Camarines Sur on 01 Feb 2018.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf rebels ambushed a police patrol car in Lantawan town area, Basilan on February 1. There were no casualties.
A former village chairman was killed by unidentified armed men at a bridge in Barangay Laoac, Alcala town, Pangasinan on February 2.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf rebels bombed the house of district engineer Soler Undug in Isabela City, Basilan on 2 February. They were trying to extort him. There were no casualties.
Arrests: The alleged finance officer of the New People's Army was arrested by the military and the police in Butuan City, Agusan del Norte on February 2.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in San Fernando, Cebu on 4 February. 1 police was wounded during the shootout.
An intelligence officer survived an ambush by unidentified armed men in Barangay Bagutari, Santo Tomas town, Isabela on February 4.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A Manobo leader and his son were killed by suspected members of the New People's Army in Barangay Palma Gil, Talaingod town, Davao del Norte on February 4. The 2 victims were CAFGUs.

source: Manila Bulletin; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by unidentified assailants at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 04 Feb 2018.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Tayabas City, Quezon on 5 February.
Agreement: Two Maranao families settled their rido (clan war) with the help of soldiers from the 6th Infantry Battalion in Barangay Matling, Malabang town, Lanao del Sur on February 6.

The New People's Army harassed residents (used them as human shields) of Barangay Langgawisan, Maragusan town, Davao de Oro on 6 February. There were no reported casualties. Thousands of residents of Barangay Langgawisan fled their village due to the harassment.

source: ABS CBN; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Northbound Philippines News Online
notes: A drug suspect was killed by unidentified assailants at Tubao, La Union on 06 Feb 2018.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Bocaue, Bulacan on 06 Feb 2018.
Agreement: 35 NPA rebels, and 93 of their civilian supporters, surrendered to the military in Sumilao, Bukidnon on February 7.
Eight persons belonging to or allied with a Moro family embroiled in a rido (clan dispute) were wounded by a grenade allegedly set off by the rival family in Banisilan town, Cotabato on February 7.

Western Mindanao's third most wanted person was killed during a police operation in Barangay Benuatan, Dinas town, Zamboanga del Sur on February 7. He was accused of, among other things, committing murder, selling drugs, and extortion.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
source: Philippine News Agency; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect and village watchman was killed during a police operation in Barangay San Agustin, San Miguel town, Bulacan on February 8.

Maute rebels had an encounter with the military and police at Barangay Lumba Punod, Pantar, Lanao del Norte on 8 February. 3 rebels were killed.
A drug suspect was killed during a police operation in Barangay Santa Cruz, San Antonio town Nueva Ecija on February 9.

Soldiers from the 33rd Infantry Battalion recovered two abandoned NPA camps formerly under a Commander MacMac and Commander Yoyo at Barangay Santo Nino, Bagumbayan town, Sultan Kudarat on Feb 9.

Kadamay members and thousands of the urban poor held a protest march from the National Housing Authority at Quezon City to the Senate building and Chino Roces bridge at Manila on February 9. They called for the end of the eviction of the urban poor.

notes: Two drug suspects, including a village councilor were killed during a joint police-PDEA operation in Malapatan town, Sarangani on February 9.

Protestors associated with Bayan and other activist groups demonstrated in front of the Chinese consulate in Manila, Metro Manila on February 10. They were protesting against China's supposed militarization of the South China Sea.

Government employees staged a protest and demanded a salary increase in Manila, Metro Manila on February 21.

notes: One Feb 23, two soldiers had an encounter with unidentified armed men in Cotabato City, Cotabato. One soldier was killed, while his companion was wounded. Later in the day Marine officers attending to the remains of a slain soldier had an encounter with two unidentified armed men in Cotabato City, Cotabato. 1 of the gunmen was killed, while the other was wounded. 1 marine died.
Students from the University of the Philippines Mindanao joined a nation-wide walkout against Duterte in Davao City, Davao del Sur on February 23.

Students from the University of Philippines Diliman joined the nationwide walkout to protest the Duterte admininstration at their campus in Quezon City, Metro Manila on February 24. They would walk from their campus to Mendiola, Manila.
The Archbishop of Cebu led at least 5,000 people through a 2-kilometer 'Walk for Life' in Cebu City, Cebu protesting the War on Drugs, and other laws, like the legalization of divorce.

Protestors from Bayan, the Movement Against Tyranny, and other activist groups demonstrated in front of the People Power Monument in Quezon City, Metro Manila on 24 February. They were celebrating the 32nd anniversary of the 1986 EDSA Revolution and protesting against the Duterte administration.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A CAFGU was killed by a suspected NPA sniper in Barangay Cabugao, Bulalacao, Oriental Mindoro on February 24.

Students from different universities in Manila joined the nationwide walkout to protest the Duterte admininstration at their campus in Manila, Metro Manila on February 24. They would walk from their campuses to Mendiola, Manila.
A MILF clan and a MNLF clan clashed in Barangay Kidama, Matalam town, Cotabato on 24 February. No fatalities or casualties were listed.
2 BIFF rebels were arrested after a brief firefight with soldiers from the 34th Infantry Battalion in Barangay Nabalawag, Midsayap town, Cotabato on February 24.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

Soldiers from the 68th Infantry Battalion launched an air and ground assault on NPA rebels in Barangay Abong-Abong, Maluso, Basilan on February 24. 6 rebels were killed.
A MILF clan and a MNLF clan clashed in Barangay Marbel, Matalam town, Cotabato on 25 February. There were 2 fatalities on each side.

The New People's Army allegedly set off an explosion near the headquarters of the 514th Engineering Construction Battalion in Barangay 09 (Poblacion), Catanauan City, Quezon on February 25. There were no casualties.
A village councilor was shot and wounded by unidentified armed gunmen in the hinterlands of Barangay Salvador, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur on February 25.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect and his wife were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Mati City, Davao Oriental on February 25.
A drug suspect was shot dead during a police raid in Talisay City, Cebu on February 26. Three of his companions were arrested.
Property destruction: The New People's Army torched a tractor at Hacienda Conchita, Barangay Sag-Ang, La Castellana, Negros Occidental on February 26.
Soldiers seized five NPA camps in Barangay Bangayan, Kitcharao town, Agusan del Norte on 26 February. 3 rebels were killed, while there were no military casualties reported.

Drug suspects were shot in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental on February 26. The other died, while the other one was wounded. They had previously turned themselves in for illegal drugs.

assoc_actor_1: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)

Police officers violently dispersed a protest camp set up by farmer-activists associated with KMP in front of the Department of Agriculture's office at Quezon City, Metro Manila on February 26.
Property destruction: The New People's Army ransacked a ranch in Barangay Nasalaan, San Francisco, Quezon on February 26.

Soldiers from the 17th Infantry Battalion had an encounter with NPA rebels in Barangay Abariongan Uneg, Santo Nino, Cagayan on February 26. 1 soldier was wounded, while there was an indeterminate number of casualties on the rebels' side.
A drug suspect was wounded during a shootout with a police officer in Barangay Rizal, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental on February 27. The other police officer was wounded.
A village councilman was shot dead by unidentified armed men somewhere in the province of Pangasinan, Ilocos Region on February 27.
